website_summaries.verdict: A perch and a grooming tool in one, this option is designed to condition beaks and nails.
pros: Cement files nails with every step
Helps keep beaks clean and healthy
Uneven surface boosts blood circulation and improves overall foot health
Varying thicknesses allow birds to pick a personal sweet spot
Comes in 5 sizes to accommodate all bird types

customer_reviews.title: I'm thinking that the people that have issues with this ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm thinking that the people that have issues with this must put the scratchy side up? there is a smooth flat area that should be facing the sky, for the pads of the feet, the scratchy side should be pointed down, where the birds nails will be. i have not had any issues with this item so far. my lovebird even rubs his beak on this thing to file that down too! i have plenty of other perches too, so the bird can use this one when he wants to/needs to. I think his nails have seemed less sharp since I installed this.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Sehl

customer_reviews.title: Loving World Pedi Perch
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, well made perch. This will hold up to all the play and rough housing a Parrot can do. One part is soft-the rest is rough sanding perch for talon manicuring. Be sure and put the soft side up so little feet will be more comfortable. The nails will still get filed, as they hit the sanded side. We have used this type of perch for years, and have always had nicely trimmed nails on our birds. They get quite sharp without regular care. One bird is quite traumatized when getting nails trimmed, so this is a good alternative for her.
customer_reviews.author: Linda v.

customer_reviews.title: My Quaker chose this as her new favorite perch barely an hour after I put it in ...
customer_reviews.text: My Quaker chose this as her new favorite perch barely an hour after I put it in her cage. She's hit and miss on most new things, and didn't bat an eye at this. The neutral color and modest size did nothing to intimidate her and after a week, I've noticed her claws are slightly less sharp. My one gripe is that it arrived cracked across a narrow portion, but whatever is being used as a core has kept it from affecting the stability. The washers included as anchors are very large compared to most perches I've bought, which is wonderful and appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Probably not a dog

customer_reviews.title: Well made and not too sandy textured - just right
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy as it was an add-on and perches such as these can be high priced. It was well made, no breaks in the covering of the perch. Fit snug to the cage wires and I love the different widths of the perch to help with health feet. The texture was just right and not over done to cause problems. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SPTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works for Parakeets
customer_reviews.text: My parakeets aren't going as crazy over this as they do over some chewing toys, but I think that will allow it to last them a long time. They definitely perch on it routinely, and I've seen them picking at it enough to know it's helping with beak maintenance a bit! It's an ideal budgie size. Update: This has become the favorite perch, and both birds pick it at from time to time, but more often, I teens to see them rubbing their heads against it as a way to scratch and itch. It's defintely been a purchase worth making.
customer_reviews.author: cmosier

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this perch for my baby parakeet/budgie and it came packaged well and was a very sturdy and a high quality perch for the value. I love that the texture is rough so that it can be used for beak and nail trimming but sadly my bird was a bit intimidated by it and prefers natural wood perches in her cage. I still do keep it nearby and in her playpen and sometimes do see her using it but it’s definitely not a favorite. Also, I’m not sure if I misread the description but I was expecting it to come in a green color rather than the blue. Other than that I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a pigeon!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the large for a pet pigeon (11 year old rescued feral), he loves it and it keeps his nails trim. Pigeons can't grip round dowel perches, but he has no trouble using this perch. Well constructed and good price, item was well packaged and arrived in perfect condition. The large would be a good size for amazons, greys, eclectus, cockatoos, and smaller macaw species. I may even get one for my Bantam Sebright chickens! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kari JoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Beak
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cockatiel because his beak and nails weren't looking very good. It took a couple weeks before I noticed him going on this perch, but now he is on it all the time, and his beak and nails are looking great. He likes to nap on this perch.
customer_reviews.author: Joyrascal

customer_reviews.title: Product well made but very HEAVY.
customer_reviews.text: The problem with this product for me is that it was so heavy that it was bending the cage bars. My cage is well made and is not flimsy. I also believe that the pearch a (Large) was too big for my Red Lored Amazon. The product itself is well made and im sure would do a good job of blunting sharp nails. When choosing size I would recommend going smaller rather than larger. Make sure you pay attention the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Size large is excellent for African Grey.
customer_reviews.text: Bought size Large for African Grey. Good size perch for my bird. Quality of the material is good as well.Problem is in installment. I installed it between the bars of the cage.The perch does not stay straight. Because Its edges were not cut evenly so its tilted down. My bird slides down all the time. I hope that I can get a refund for used perch. Updated 10/15/18. Thanks to Amazon I got Refund.
customer_reviews.author: Roma Grey

customer_reviews.title: His favorite perch
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice perch. My boi loves it so much he’s on it most of the time when he is in his cage. I personally haven’t seen him chewing on it but he has a cuttlebone right next to it so I’m unsure if that’s why he hasn’t chewed on it. He sleeps and preens here and prefers it over his thick wooden perch. May get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Brian-Candace Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The BEST concrete perch I’ve found...
customer_reviews.text: Living World Pedi-Perches are superb concrete perches, and I highly recommend them—as does my 25-year-old African Grey parrot (Homer). These perches definitely help to keep his claws nicely trimmed and from becoming too sharp. He frequently uses them to clean his beak after eating or drinking (he’s very tidy), the same way we might swipe a knife back and forth across a honing steel. Also, the multi-grip surface has a smooth topside, which dedicates the gnarly, claw-trimming surfaces to his claws, while providing a smooth top-surface for his tender foot-pads—just wonderfully perfectly perfect. Living World Pedi-Perches elegantly and thoughtfully contribute to Homer’s little-bird happiness—and to his pet Human’s happiness, too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Zarnek

customer_reviews.title: Took a while for my Cockatiel to get use to but GREAT for his nails!!
customer_reviews.text: We've had cement perches forever, but my bird had recently been chewing the end. Time for a new one! This perch, though odd looking, fits the bill! The wavy bumps took a while for him to get used to, but now all is great and his nails will be kept trim!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara D

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, very stable, my 4.5months african grey loves it
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: No More Bloody Hands From Nails
customer_reviews.text: We have a new to us, 20 year old African Grey. He is a bit set in his ways and in the process of being hand trained. His nails had been trimmed before we got him 3 months ago. Recently however, every time I picked him up my hands were left with razor cuts all over them. Biting parrots do not like to have their nails trimmed! I ordered two of these perches and placed them in Jesse's cage in addition to his regular perch. A few short days later and I am no longer being torn to shreds. Thank you so much for this pedi-perch. It has made bird training so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Not Thrilled With The Size or The Material
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the smallest version of this perch available. It's still too big and bulky for my parakeet. In addition, the perch is a concrete type material and the perch came cracked. Amazon refunded my money and I threw the perch away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best quality will buy again!
customer_reviews.text: This bird perch is a very high-quality it’s solid cement and will last a very long time. My bird loves it. I have several different sizes that are all available on Amazon. They are actually lower in cost compared to some of the lower end per cha this bird perch is a very high-quality it’s solid cement and will last a very long time. My bird loves it. I have several different sizes that are all available on Amazon. They are actually lower in cost compared to some of the lower end perches.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K.

customer_reviews.title: A good perch
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mini size for my lovebird, and it came in the same color (a muted/smoky mauve) as the picture on here. She seems to prefer sand and wood perches better, but she'll occasionally hop on this one and wipe her beak. I don't think she's on it enough for it to file her nails down. The price is great for this heavy but sturdy, small perch. As for sizing, this fits one small bird (lovebird, budgie, etc.), but go the next size up for birds bigger than that or for a pair of small birds.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Myrnloy

customer_reviews.title: Warning
customer_reviews.text: Took my Eclectus to my Avian Vet and she gave me the warnings of using sand or concrete perches. #1, the birds develop raw spots on the bottoms of their feet. #2 Since they like to clean their beaks after eating, they will also rub their beaks on the perch so much to the point of thinning the beak to that causes the beak to crack or break. She said to use all natural wood and for me to get rid of mine. What a waste of money. Don’t buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Rotbone

customer_reviews.title: budgie seems to like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought the small perch for my budgie. Despite other reviews saying the circumference is too large for smaller birds, Ace loves this perch the most. Seems as if it gives her a break from having to balance on other perches. I can't tell if it does anything to decrease the frequency of toenail trimmings, but it doesn't take care of it altogether. Ace is happy, I'm happy. I just wish I'd bought the longer one; she likes to run back and forth along this but there's not much space.
customer_reviews.author: pacifico

customer_reviews.title: Proved useless
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Lady Gouldian or rainbow finches. The male's beak kept overgrowing. Research said he needed something to trim his beak against. This perch was much larger than I thought it would be... the diameter given must be for the smaller indented areas. That aside, neither of my birds would spend any time on it except to poop. Because of the rough surface it was impossible to wipe clean. It had to be taken out, cleaned and reinstalled... too much bother for something that wasn't serving its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey1328

customer_reviews.title: Favorite perch in cage!
customer_reviews.text: (Indian Ringneck) He loves this perch! I had to take some toys out to take his picture, that's why it looks so empty in there. He sleeps on this perch every night! I have him out all day, but when I put him back in his cage when I leave for work or when it's time for bed this perch is the first place he goes. Definitely will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Ionasan

customer_reviews.title: So that was nice, however I think it might be too big ...
customer_reviews.text: The color they sent me just so happen to be the exact color of my cage! So that was nice, however I think it might be too big for my green cheek conure. I ordered a medium as suggested by some of the other reviews, but his nail hardly reach the rough surface. Not sure if it is even trimming his nails down at all. I'm keeping it in case it is and it's a nice perch, plus the color was just right. Like some reviews said though, it does oddly resemble an "adult toy".
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Zensky

customer_reviews.title: Recommended !
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money. It is made of a cement type material and not sand covered plastic. I went with another reviewer's suggestion and bought the size small for my Sun Conure and the size is perfect ! Definitely recommend this perch !
customer_reviews.author: Katharine L.

customer_reviews.title: Great perches
customer_reviews.text: Excellent perches for medium to larger parrots for keeping claws ground down somewhat. Sturdy and come with large washers to easily mount on cage bars.
customer_reviews.author: Loving Caretaker

customer_reviews.title: A BIT BIG , Not small
customer_reviews.text: This is really not small when you have Parakeets, I should have gotten xsmall. That said it is in their cage and they have not really noticed it as yet. Have Parakeets get xsmall.
customer_reviews.author: jef

customer_reviews.title: SAFTEY CONCERN !!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is self is really good . I have an African Grey who was in need of a new perch it was over due so he could file his nails and beak . He loves it. Easy install, durable and long lasting . *** Reason for 2 stars , is because upon installation I did get pricked with a piece of metal in my finger which was painful. So please wear gloves and be careful. **
customer_reviews.author: Prince$$

customer_reviews.title: Good Perch
customer_reviews.text: I have two budgies and I got this both to exercise their feet and to file their nails. They seem to like it and it seems like good quality. It seems a little big to be labelled as "small" but they can use it so it works out alright. I was very easily able to attach it to my cage with 1/2 inch spaces between the bars. Can't comment on how well it files nails since they have only been using it for about a week but it looks and feels like it should work
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Doves nails are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't filed my Doves nails since I bought this. It's amazing. Unfortunately I still have to do my GCC nails but it does help. I love that this has a smooth side and that its a sturdy material that doesn't fall apart if the bird decides to rub their beak on it etc. I would definitely recommend and I've gotten a few friends to buy these as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well worth it. Huge and extremely heavy. Much bigger then expected.Don't think my birds will be destroying this one anytime soon. Great price. Will be buying more
customer_reviews.author: daniel marker

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: The picture of the item is blue. I chose medium and the picture stayed blue, soooo, the perch I received was this quite large fleshy pinkest thing that looks like a white male's genitalia. Surely this color could be changed to something much more suitable! Something more colorful and cheerful like blue, yellow or green. I don't think I want to even keep it in the cage. Shipping was fast and free!
customer_reviews.author: K417

customer_reviews.title: Too big.
customer_reviews.text: This perch was way to big for my lovebird despite a lovebird pictured on the package. It's way to thick and it scared him. Not that I blame him would you want a perch that looks like a penis hanging in your cage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Was great, exactly what I expected and nothing less. It effectively filed down my lil birdie's nails, and he loved hanging out on it (I also suggest for everyone who's birds avoid this perch to just set it as the highest perch in the cage). I never had any issues with it falling off or anything, extremely easy set up and although it was very stable it was easy to take off when the time came for it.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Han

customer_reviews.title: Great for a variety
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my canary to add a variety of perches in his cage. I was nervous that it was too big for him when I opened it but he seems to like it just fine. I do recommend putting the smooth side up so it's not too rough on your bird's little feet.
customer_reviews.author: nerbear

customer_reviews.title: Her birds love it and use it on daily basis and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this perch for my cousin's birds who lives in Pakistan as she got budgies as a gift for herself so I had to make sure her birds gets the right stuff since these perches aren't available in her country. Her birds love it and use it on daily basis and I think she got this in blue color. I have this same perch but in Mini size in nude pink color for my 4 budgies and they love it and use this on daily basis. We both sisters recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Afshan

customer_reviews.title: Cracks
customer_reviews.text: I received this with 2 cracks in it. I got it for my daughters 2 oz parrot. The medium size I think is too big for the 2 oz parrot, with the cracks in it it has to stay on the lower part of the cage for fear if it breaks it could hurt the parrot because it is so heavy so the parrot does not use it . It was easy to set up and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: CAME BROKEN
customer_reviews.text: Came already broken with huge cracks in it that go 360 across. Really mad because I was excited for this and now I can’t even use it. Please send me a replacement or refund. It wasn’t due to the shipping either since the package was fine
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Richards

customer_reviews.title: The washer that comes with it is far too small to ensure a good fit between bars on many cages
customer_reviews.text: Product is just OK. The washer that comes with it is far too small to ensure a good fit between bars on many cages. It actually fell down while my bird was on it even though I (erroneously) thought that it was secured. At first I though, "no big deal" and intended to pick up a larger washer at the local home big box store. Not easily accomplished since the bolt is small enough that in order to get a washer big enough to fit the circumference of the perch itself, the center holes of the washers were all too large, thus, making the wingnut not able to fit tightly. Not worth the hassle, or the money.
customer_reviews.author: Zeeba

customer_reviews.title: Keep your bird’s feet healthy!
customer_reviews.text: I love these perches (well, my bird does). Several different diameter perched strategically situated in the cage and you’re golden.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Bridge Vmd

customer_reviews.title: Not sized for parakeets
customer_reviews.text: The material would probably have worked as a beak and claw sharpener but I bought 5 of these in extra small (the smallest size) and they were still twice as big as I could use for my parakeets.
customer_reviews.author: marianne m

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as pictured and described.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Identicle to what the picture shows. Largest was perfect size for my macaw. Arrived with a crack but doesnt seem to affect functionality. Bird is happy therefore I am happy. 4 starts because of crack...crack in the perch, not smokeable crack lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good perch
customer_reviews.text: This perch is well made. It is bigger and heavier than I thought so it tilts one side of the hanging cage. But, my birds seem to like it and it does give a change for their little feet to grip onto a bigger perch.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie T. Oconnell

customer_reviews.title: Not the color that is showed. : (.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a short perch and I liked the color in the picture because it looked a natural color. However, the one I got was blue. Thankfully it’s not a bright blue but a dull blue so I’m keeping it because it’s the size I needed. That is the reason I only gave four stars.
customer_reviews.author: TexasGigi

customer_reviews.title: great little perch
customer_reviews.text: my cockatiel perches on it all the time without any problem I don't know if it really trims the claws if so I wish it would do it more because she still has pretty sharp claws. I don't think this hurts her in any way its flat on one side and I have that side on the top so that its not scraping her feet just the claws that wrap around to the underside of it
customer_reviews.author: WhitneyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: APPROVED by Kelly Cockatiel
customer_reviews.text: Took three days before she ventured on this well constructed perch. Now it's just part of her 'highway' around her home territory. Bill and toenails are being used as I had hoped. She recommends.
customer_reviews.author: Retired but still kicking

customer_reviews.title: parrotlet likes it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parrotlet (size small). It is a little bit big but my parrotlet likes it and I see him sitting on these often. It is great for his beak, he uses it to rub his beak on and keep it in good shape. Cons: very heavy ETA: I also bought the mini/xs size and it is a perfect size for parrotlets, BUT, it’s super short. It’s only like 4” or 5” long. It really needs to be longer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Breakfast Princess

customer_reviews.title: *I* like it ;)
customer_reviews.text: - Arrived quickly, is exactly as described. I had a "nail trimming perch" in the cage in the past, and it worked well but she wore it smooth!, so I expect these to work as well. ((I also got a large one, which is in front of her food and water bowls.)) And she of course has a variety of other things to perch and climb on. I think these are a good compliment to the other perches and whatnot :)
customer_reviews.author: K. M. KriegerTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Works well and has stood up for 2 years now
customer_reviews.text: I use this medium perch in the travel cage for my yellow crowned Amazon. I've had it for 2 years now and it was a good purchase. Smooth side goes on top. Rough side faces down to passively the birds nails. Won't trim the nails enough by itself but helps even if just a little. I'll take every little bit.
customer_reviews.author: MikeFM

customer_reviews.title: Great for birds feet.
customer_reviews.text: These are great because they have a smooth area on the top so it won’t scratch the birds feet but it keeps the nail trim. The only thing is these are a large perch, too big for my Conures.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Good perch
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do the job. The mini is VERY short. Holds one parakeet comfortably. Will order a bigger one. All in all good perch. Also put the smooth side up for them to stand on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: OMG!!! They are more than perfect! I bought 2! The size is perfect! I tough they will be smaller but I was wrong!!! They are incredible!! Big and heavy!! I'm sooo pleased with the order!!! I will definitely order more!!!thanks amazon. And the seller
customer_reviews.author: Casandra Torrales

customer_reviews.title: Decent perch
customer_reviews.text: My bird loves this perch. It is a very sturdy perch that is the perfect size for a medium sized bird. It is easy to attach to the cage, the only thing is that I feel like it might be too heavy for the metal pieces that connect it to the cage because it kind of tilts down and doesn't stick out straight no matter how tight I try to twist the back metal piece on it. Overall it works just fine and my bird is satisfied with it which is what really matters.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Beason

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a great perch. I gave it 4 rather than 5 stars only because I had to add a bigger washers, the one's with it were not big enough to spread the bars of my cage to keep it secure. Since its a larger perch I think the washers with it should be a more appropriate size.
customer_reviews.author: Feather Foot

customer_reviews.title: I'd opt for a 3.5 star if I could
customer_reviews.text: + My bird really likes the perch, and she can't exactly destroy cement, so I won't need to be replacing it. This is a huge plus for me, because she destroys things like there's no tomorrow. - The perch and the fasteners are all painted, which seems a little ridiculous when you take into consideration the fact that birds put things in their mouths. - The weight of it is also something to consider. On it's own it's fine, but with the added weight of my bird it sags and pulls against the bars. Not enough to bend them out of shape, but it is something that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great for a large bird.
customer_reviews.text: What I really wanted was a 13" long perch that would be comfortable on the feet of my older cockatiel. I didn't think about how this perch would be thick for a larger bird. This is heavy, and designed for larger, sturdier cages. I tried it out in my cockatiel's cage anyway (adding a perch below it for extra support.) He really really liked it, but it was too massive for his cage. I had to get two smaller sized perches to go across the cage. I gave this perch to a friend with cockatoos and amazons, and she loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L.

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Great perch for keeping my birds' nails trimmed. I love that the gritty surface is only on the lower half, so their nails are getting filed, but their feet aren't getting damaged. I'd definitely purchase more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Mell37

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the price, and it looks so good in the cage! My parakeets love it!
customer_reviews.author: AnimalMama314

customer_reviews.title: Great perch, I wish my bird would use it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great perch, very secure and well made. I like that there is a smooth spot for their feet to rest while being rough where their nails go. My conure is terrified of it, but that's not the perch's fault. She's just weird.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Harding

customer_reviews.title: Budgies love it
customer_reviews.text: This product seemed bigger than advertised when I received it. I re-read the description and other reviews and decided to try it in my budgie's cage. They are using it a lot and it seems to work well along with a variety of other perch sizes and textures.
customer_reviews.author: Cathe

customer_reviews.title: Is your bird color sensitive?
customer_reviews.text: Was sent a flesh colored perch. Really? Flesh colored. It loks like part of an arm. My African Grey freaked out. Won't go near it. Have no idea if perch would have done what it is supposed to do. 15 bucks down the drain. I recommend going with a vendor that can guarantee a color choice.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Ribbed for your bird's perching pleasure
customer_reviews.text: My African grey loves her new concrete dong so much that I've already purchased two more for her cage. The textured side also helps keep her claws under control. These things are easy to install, easy to clean and (if you're the type that giggles at phallic objects) look great too.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Gray

customer_reviews.title: Parrot approved
customer_reviews.text: My CAG parrot likes this perch. But I really don't know if it's going anything for his nails. They seem as sharp as ever. But it works for a nice small sturdy perch anyway. So eh, good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zin Stone

customer_reviews.title: No go for my conure.
customer_reviews.text: I like it but my bird doesn't seem to want to use it at all. I don't think he feels secure sitting on it from the smooth area on there. Won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Emz

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a citron cockatoo and she can’t fly do we purchase 3 of this perches to put around her cage she loves to be all around and close to everyone that sits around her. They are nice and her to keep her nails trimmed.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great in all the other ways if it didn't arrive broken
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice color and size, all as described, but it arrived with a sizable crack down the middle, which I hope won't cause it to break in half soon. I don't deal with returns because life is too busy, so let's hope it holds up!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Terrifying
customer_reviews.text: It's been in my canary's cage about a week and he's terrified of it. Wouldn't perch on it if his life depended on it. I even took out his plastic perch to forch him to try it out. No dice.
customer_reviews.author: PJMZ28

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it would work great but seeing where as my little green cheek conure ...
customer_reviews.text: Clearly well made, study. My only complaint is the baby blue. BARF! I didn't realize that the listing said assorted colors and purchased based off of the color shown and reviews. I'm sure it would work great but seeing where as my little green cheek conure has several perch options, he's continued to choose other footings. I'm thinking a cleverly placed treat is all it'll take to get him to try it out. Overall, based on quality alone I'd purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kally Paschall

customer_reviews.title: It is working.
customer_reviews.text: I tested his nails. He is a wonderful loving bird, rescue, but I can't take the blood drawing. So Im glad to find this perch. I put it by the water so he had to land and take off from it. I was starting to look like a walking dead!!
customer_reviews.author: B.C. Legans

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This perch works great and I can definitely tell a difference in my jendays nails but it is very heavy and bends the bars of his cage. Not the biggest deal but I couldn't put it where I had originally intended because it has to have vertical and horizontal cross section to be stable. I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: joanna e

customer_reviews.title: Its alright...
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my parakeet, as i like him to have various sized perches. This one is fine, its different than the wood and plastic ones i have for sure. He just likes to sit on it and nibble his millet seeds. But the thing is, it doesnt do much in the way of the birds toenails. Theyre still as long as ever, these dont do anything. I brought those replaceable paper ones at my local pet store, and honestly those are alot better for people who are afraid of trimming their birds claws. So my bird likes it, which gave it three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Iridescence

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Attaches to cage on one side. My parrot has not been able to break or tear up and that is a plus. He was suspicous at first but after a week, he accepted it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, does the job I'm sure lol.
customer_reviews.text: I would love this item if I didn't have to worry about it breaking with my birds on it lol. It seems to be still sturdy enough but you never know with a crack all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe these perches are so inexpensive, and yet so practical! My bird loved them immediately, they were easy to install, and colorful. Also my bird has sensitive feet, and he was very comfortable with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality,  easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, I just ordered the wrong size or their sizing is a bit different from other companies. Make sure to double check your perches before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: clothes horse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pedi Perch
customer_reviews.text: Great perch for my Eclectus and African Grey to help with keeping their nails down and cleaning their beaks.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Brumbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent perch
customer_reviews.text: Exact same perch that you get at the pet store for more money. Perfect size for my quaker to give him different size perches from the rope perches and also help keep his nails trimmed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and cold
customer_reviews.text: This perch is grossly made. It’s humongous and too tick for my Amazon feet. This perch is design of perch is more suitable for Macaws parrots!
customer_reviews.author: Ana Downing

customer_reviews.title: stays put
customer_reviews.text: we rescued a baby starling and took it home when we couldn't find its nest. since then we've read up and saw they really need a perch that helps file down their nails. the medium may have been too big? not sure. but i has helped a little. he still has sharp nails but definitely not as lethal as it once was. i may also try a natural wooden perch to see if both can help. he has been swiping his beak across this perch after eating. hopefully it's dulling the beak rather than sharpening it! overall good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: g.nuggs

customer_reviews.title: Smaller perches great.
customer_reviews.text: The small and mediums in these are great, but the large ones, not so much. My smaller birds love them. I've had no issues with cracking like in the large ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Bird does not like it
customer_reviews.text: My bird will not use this perch. I have this and another concrete perch and it will not go on either. She prefers the seashell perch. I purchased the following and she loves this perch: Prevue Pet Products BPV1006 Natural Seashell Beachwalk Bird Perch. She goes to this every time she is put back in the cage. She chews the end of this one. I can not recommended the concrete perches. IE my bird cant anyway.
customer_reviews.author: James Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Good Perch
customer_reviews.text: My cockatiel loves sitting on it and it’s made with good quality materials which stays put to cage wall, I soak it before cleaning it which makes it easier
customer_reviews.author: Bhavin Patel

customer_reviews.title: Will purchase more in future!
customer_reviews.text: Love these type of perches, the birds are happy with them, so I will purchase more in the future, to change them out when they need new items to play with.
customer_reviews.author: dadavisof4

customer_reviews.title: Safest Nail Control Perch
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the harmful sandpaper perches, these are rough, but shouldn't harm bird feet. The price is very worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: People recommended sizes for my orange wing amazon. I got a medium as recommend and it’s huge! My bird hates it and her feet barely fit around it. I gave it three stars because it is a good perch just very big and super super heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Nev

customer_reviews.title: Jacob Birdie’s Happy Perch!
customer_reviews.text: This perch must be comfy on the feet because this is where I find my Conure most of the time now. Perched & happy. Will be buying another one or two for his house.
customer_reviews.author: dSharp

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but seems a little large for my parakeet.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a wonderful product, which is why I gave it 5 stars, but even the smallest size seems really large for my parakeet. We bought this to trim her nails, but she won't go near it. I haven't given up because other reviewers said their parakeets love it, so we're slowly removing other perches while strategically placing this in front of her food dish. I like the idea that it will improve her circulation and trim her nails so I'm still optimistic!
customer_reviews.author: Connor McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Great perch for the job
customer_reviews.text: This keeps the sharp points of my parakeets nails worn down, so I dont have to risk trimming them, or pay the vet to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Jackson

customer_reviews.title: my keeps feet healthy and beaks in top shape.
customer_reviews.text: my Eclectus parrot loves these perches. They keep his feet healthy and beaks in top shape.
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Vixen

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: My two parakeets barely use it so I cant say for sure how well it is for them. It is a bit heave so after putting I in the cage it kind of stays at a slant but nothing too major. I got the medium size one
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: A good addition to your bird's house.
customer_reviews.text: I switched the new perch and placed it under one of my bird's favorite toys. It was a seamless transition. It has dulled down his nails some, but not as much as I had hoped. We are both happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great size for our African Grey.
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 African Grey parrots and this is the perfect size for them. Seems very well made.
customer_reviews.author: ANISSA GILMORE

customer_reviews.title: Nice perch, the small is a great size for ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice perch, the small is a great size for a cockatiel and it does help with his nails. I wish I could have picked the color.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These perches work great. Not the easiest to clean, but they are sturdy. This one is the one my bird favors for sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: jnzdogs

customer_reviews.title: and we're happy with both sizes
customer_reviews.text: We have multiple Living World Pedi-Perches in our zebra finches' cage. We used both the Mini and the Medium, and we're happy with both sizes. The Mini is a little small for multiple birds to sit on, so they tend to use the Medium more, but they're all utilized in our cage.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer O CoteTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My macaw takes a day or two to get to ...
customer_reviews.text: My macaw takes a day or two to get to know the toy then he is fully using it to sharpen his beak and it has helped with his nails. It is a larger heavy toy but it comes with a large washer to help support and hold it on the bars of the cage without falling for it due to the heavy weight.. My macaw can sit on it and it does not move once I attached the large washersm
customer_reviews.author: LisaEastCoastGurl

customer_reviews.title: Best concrete perch
customer_reviews.text: I got a size small for a parakeet. I think it's perfect. What the description doesn't mention (and should) is that there is a side that is smooth so it's safe for the bird's feet yet when their toes curl around the perch to the rough sides, it is working to file them.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Macaw likes it
customer_reviews.text: This perch is tougher and appears to be more durable than other snow-covered perches. It is filing his nails nicely.
customer_reviews.author: John Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Quliaty seems good, size is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.text: The “small” is WAY too big for our lovebird. He is totally disinterested in it. Two stars for quality, but knocking off three for it being laughably big for a small.
customer_reviews.author: Springlering

customer_reviews.title: Nice perch
customer_reviews.text: This perch is OK but my lovebird and parakeet didnt like it so I gave it to a friend and his bird loves it
customer_reviews.author: Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put on and off, nice little perch to use on the outside of the cage since they don't stick out too far.
customer_reviews.author: DK

product_meta.title: Living World Pedi-Perch
product_meta.description: Size:Medium| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Living World Pedi-Perch is an essential addition to your bird's home. It is a cement bird perch that helps trim and maintain blunt, well-groomed nails. The multi-grip wave surface promotes foot circulation and helps prevent arthritis and atrophy. In addition, the Pedi-Perch helps clean and condition the bird's beak.
feature_bullets: Essential tool for your bird to maintain proper circulation in its feet
Files your bird's claws; Securely fastens to your cage
Add multiple perches for various resting spots

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
